metadata.title: CVE-2014-2902 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
wolfssl before 3.2.0 does not properly authorize CA certificate for signingother certificates.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl15 - 3.13.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0+dfsg-1').
